title: Up to a quarter million Ford Explorers recalled for rollaway risk
description: Up to a quarter million Ford Explorers are being recalled due to a mechanical problem that can cause the SUV to roll away while it's parked, according to documents from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: New glass bridge in Vietnam suspends visitors between two mountains
description: The Bach Long bridge is open for thrill-seeking visitors, offering a glass-bottomed walkway suspended nearly 500 feet above the ground.

title: How powerful is a Trump endorsement?
description: In today's episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza examines whether former President Donald Trump's endorsement will be the difference-maker in the Ohio GOP Senate primary.

title: Biden jokes Trump was a 'horrible plague' in remarks at White House Correspondents' Dinner
description: President Joe Biden took a dig at his predecessor Saturday at the White House Correspondents' Dinner, while also joking about the press, the GOP and the continued existence of the event altogether.

title: Why car shopping is so bizarre in the United States
description: The way we buy cars in America is just weird.

title: Corrections officer and inmate go missing on way to court
description: Lauderdale County, Alabama, authorities are searching for a sheriff's office employee and an inmate who went missing on their way to the courthouse on Friday at around 9:30 a.m.

title: Don't look up: 2022's first solar eclipse will appear in the southern hemisphere today
description: Today, people in some parts of southern South America, Antarctica, and the Pacific and Southern Oceans will be able to watch the first solar eclipse of the year.

title: Texts between Fox's Sean Hannity and Trump White House revealed
description: Former White House chief of staff Mark Meadows and Fox's Sean Hannity exchanged more than 80 text messages between Election Day 2020 and Joe Biden's January 2021 inauguration, communications that show Hannity's evolution from staunch supporter of former President Donald Trump's election lies to being "fed up" with the "lunatics" hurting Trump's cause in the days before January 6.

title: Lake Powell officials face an impossible choice in the West's megadrought: Water or electricity
description: Lake Powell, the country's second-largest reservoir, is drying up.

title: Real Madrid wins 35th La Liga title with 4-0 win against Espanyol
description: Real Madrid wrapped up the La Liga title with a comprehensive 4-0 victory against Espanyol on Saturday.

title: Connecticut lawmakers pass bill to protect abortion seekers and providers from out-of-state lawsuits
description: Connecticut lawmakers on Friday passed a bill designed to protect people who provide an abortion or receive support to obtain the procedure in Connecticut and are then sued in another state.

title: UK Conservative politician resigns after admitting watching porn in Parliament
description: A Member of Parliament in British Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservative Party, Neil Parish, said Saturday he will resign after admitting twice watching pornography in the House of Commons.

title: Soccer super agent Mino Raiola dies aged 54
description: Mino Raiola, considered one of the most successful and influential soccer agents in the world, has died, according to a statement from his family posted on Raiola's social media pages. He was 54.

title: Dozens of buildings leveled after a powerful tornado tears through Wichita area
description: A powerful tornado tore through the Wichita area Friday night, leveling dozens of structures in the city of Andover, according to officials.

title: Elon Musk wants end-to-end encryption for Twitter DMs. It may not be that simple
description: Just two days after he announced he would buy Twitter, Elon Musk sent out a deluge of tweets about his plans for the social media platform. One stood out for its broad appeal.

title: Planet-warming emissions from cow burps have been seen from space
description: Methane emissions burped up by cows have been observed from space.

title: How Johnny Depp and Amber Heard ended up in court -- 13 years after first meeting
description: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard are currently spending their days in a Fairfax, Virginia courthouse.

title: DeSantis is trying to out-Trump Trump
description: Despite his defeat in 2020, former President Donald Trump's incendiary style of politics is threatening to become the dominant strain in the GOP. For proof, look no further than the rise of Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, who is shaping up to be one of Trump's potential GOP challengers in 2024.

title: Is there any way to negoitate with Putin?
description: Is there any way to negotiate with Putin? A psychiatrist who worked in the US Embassy in Moscow says, "One of the things you see in many aging leaders, especially authoritarian leaders, is as they age, their decision-making becomes a bit more rigid and less flexible."

title: A dolphin was impaled with a 'spear-like object' in Florida -- while it was still alive
description: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) is investigating the death of a dolphin that was impaled while alive in Florida.

title: Georgia Tech students create 4.2 mile-long hopscotch in hope of setting new world record
description: A group of Georgia Tech students has created what may be the world's longest hopscotch.

title: US Army soldiers stole her birthday cake during World War II. 77 years later, they give it back
description: American soldiers took a 13-year-old's birthday cake off of a window sill while celebrating a victory in Vicenza, Italy during World War II. 77 years have passed and the US Army is making amends.

title: Farewell to 'Ozark' and 'Grace and Frankie': How to watch final episodes
description: They say all good things must come to an end, but personally I hate it.

title: Two years into the pandemic, big restaurant chains are getting stronger
description: Restaurants of all sizes have had a difficult few years — but chains are coming out on top.

title: Customs officers intercept $70,000 worth of cocaine hidden in insulated thermal cups
description: Customs officers intercepted four separate shipments of cocaine with a total street value of $70,000 hidden inside insulated thermal cups, US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) said in a statement.

title: Ukrainian tennis star asks 'What am I living for?'
description: Right now Ukrainian tennis star Marta Kostyuk is finding it tough focusing on the sport she has dedicated her life to.

title: Doctors say spending time in nature is the 'fourth pillar of health'
description: Much has been said about the healing power of nature. Now, some medical professionals in Canada are increasingly prescribing it.

title: How to watch the Katie Taylor vs. Amanda Serrano fight
description: Boxers Katie Taylor and Amanda Serrano are set to go head-to-head at Madison Square Garden on Saturday -- the first time two women will headline the iconic venue in its 140-year history.

title: Ikea's restaurants were failing. Then it turned to Swedish meatballs
description: Ikea is known for sprawling showrooms, cheap flat-pack furniture and, of course, Swedish meatballs.

title: 40M face severe storm threat this weekend
description: Two separate weather systems will bring severe storms to more than a dozen states this weekend, some of the same ones that were hit Friday night.

title: Best bucket-list trips for 2022
description: Been stuck at home so long your passport has cobwebs? It's time to start planning your comeback tour.

title: China is tightening controls and partially locking down its capital city. I'm trying to get in.
description: • Lockdowns turn millions into virtual prisoners

title: A stranger on an airplane gave her $100 and changed her life. She's been trying to find her for over a decade
description: Ayda Zugay isn't someone who normally likes to save things.

title: 11-foot alligator blocks traffic on Florida highway
description: Just when you thought rush hour couldn't get any worse.

title: They fled Ukraine to protect their children. Now these mothers are returning home
Lawsuit claims Brian Laundrie's parents knew 'whereabouts' of Gabby Petito's body when they went on vacation
description: In an amendment to their lawsuit filed earlier this spring, Gabby Petito's parents allege during the search for the young woman, Brian Laundrie's parents knew their son had killed her and knew "the whereabouts of her body."

title: Lockdowns in China turn millions into virtual prisoners
description: China's zero-Covid policy has officials using increasingly extreme measures to stop the virus from spreading. CNN's David Culver reports from Shanghai, where he remains under strict lockdown in his own home.

title: Former US Marine killed fighting alongside Ukrainians
description: Former US Marine Willy Joseph Cancel is reportedly the first American to be killed on the battlefield in Ukraine. CNN's Oren Liebermann reports.
